content: the top you ll see your chain put your hook through the bl of the chain single_crochet 2 through the bl of the chain repeat until you work through all chains bbl = braided broomstick lace requires loops in multiples of 3 20mm knitting needle suggested 1 fp a pull up loops through the bl and add them to your knitting needle for more stability you can lock your loops by doing a blch and then adding your working loop to your knitting needle note locking your loops is highly suggested for this stitch b remove all loops from your knitting needle working on a flat surface braid each group of 3 loops put a locking stitch marker through the open ends of your braid to preserve it while you braid the rest of your loops you can braid as tightly or as loosely as you want i found that 4 & 1/2 repeats of a standard braiding pattern looked nice standard braiding pattern loops are renamed after each step 1 cross left over middle 2 cross right over middle if you do not have enough stitch markers you may need to do part of your return pass and then come back to braiding 2 rp a bring the 3 loops that make up your braid on to your hook single_crochet 3 through the braid repeat until you work through all braids finished size unblocked panel 1 5 x 35 panel 2 5 x 33 blocked panel 1 6 x 36 panel 2 6 x 34 5 finished scarf 6 x 70 5 instructions panel 1 r1 fsc 32 leave a 4 tail for weaving in ends chain 1 turn r2 stsc 4 put a locking stitch marker through the working loop to maintain this while working the rest of the row you will use this to finish the row turn tbl fp chain 1 through both loops of the final st stsc 5 through the final st tbl rp finish the row by putting the loop from the stsc on to your hook this will serve as the yarn over for a half_double_crochet insert your hook through both loops of the stsc yarn over pull up a loop you ll have 3 loops on your hook yarn over and pull through all 3 loops finishing the modified half_double_crochet chain 1 turn r3 r4 single_crochet 32 chain 1 turn r5 repeat r2 but with sbl instead of tbl r6 r7 single_crochet 32 chain 1 turn r8 repeat r2 but with xbl instead of tbl r9 r10 single_crochet 32 chain 1 turn r11 repeat r2 but with crbl instead of tbl r12 r13 single_crochet 32 chain 1 turn r14 repeat r2 but with bbl instead of tbl r15 r16 single_crochet 32 chain 1 turn r17 r74 repeat r2 r16 almost 5 repeats the last special stitch will be crbl r75 repeat r2 but with bbl instead of tbl r76 single_crochet 32 fasten_off leaving a 4 tail to weave in your ends
